resources.string: Are you sure you want to skip setup?\n(It will not be displayed again. You can set everything up manually)
This step-by-step guide will make sure that your device is properly configured to use InputStick to type text from Keepass2Android application.
InputStick receiver is required for this application to work. If you already have one, please continue.\nClick link below to buy InputStick:\nwww.inputstick.com/buy
InputStickUtility application must be installed.\nYou can do this manually later.
Keepass2Android application must be installed.\nYou can do this manually later.
Uninstall previous version of the plugin to avoid duplicated actions in Keepass2Android.\nYou can do this manually later.
Set keyboard layout used by your PC.\nTest: plug InputStick into USB port, open text editor, make sure all characters were typed correctly.
Plugin must be enabled in Keepass2Android to access data when entry is opened.
Click on a field (password, user name, etc.) and select \"Type\"
Here you can find more advanced actions (masked password, macros, type from clipboard/Authenticator app) and easily access settings.
Show/hide field and entry actions. Adjust InputStick connection options.\nEnable secondary keyboard layout (e.g. German for home, English for work).
Use \"macOS setup\" from Entry options when macOS wants to identify keyboard.\nFor macOS may need to use macOS-specific keyboard layout, example: German (Mac)
You are now ready to type from Keepass2Android.\nNeed more help? Click link below:\nhttp://www.inputstick.com/help
The plugin requires permission to post notifications. Without this permission Android OS will not allow the plugin to run its background service

The plugin requires permission to display its interface over other apps. This allows display interface while Keepass2Android app is in the foreground. Once you click the button, select \"KP2A InputStick Plugin\" from the list and allow it to display over other apps
